name: Gemini 3 Hackathon Panel
description: Panel aligned with Gemini 3 Hackathon judging criteria and weights.

objective.thesis: Run a hackathon-judge style panel that evaluates the project against Gemini 3 criteria and ends with a constructive decision memo.
successDefinition: Founder explains: what they built, who it’s for, and why Gemini 3 is essential
A concrete architecture walkthrough exists (in words)
One reliability / safety boundary is explicit
A demo narrative is clear and repeatable
Panel produces a weighted verdict aligned to the rubric

discovery.label: Discovery
discovery.goal: Clarify what you built and why it matters. Friendly, curious.

interrogation.label: Pressure-test
interrogation.goal: Go deeper on one weak spot without theatrics.

bannedPhrases: what budget does it come from

judges.label: Host
judges.rolePrompt: Friendly, concise host. Collect founderName, ideaName, pitch, targetUser, targetContext, firstValue, acquisitionPath, inputSource. No hype, no negativity.

discovery.concern: I can’t yet picture the architecture and where Gemini 3 sits in the loop.
discovery.askIntent: Get a clear, concrete system diagram in words.
questionExamples: Can you describe the architecture in 5 steps and where Gemini 3 is used in each step?
What are the main components (UI, backend, data) and what does Gemini 3 do versus deterministic code?

discovery.concern: LLM reliability can break the user experience if guardrails aren’t explicit.
discovery.askIntent: Clarify failure modes and recovery strategy.
questionExamples: What’s the most likely failure case and what does the product do when it happens?
How do you prevent bad outputs from reaching the user (even with a simple rule)?

interrogation.concern: It’s unclear how you test and prove correctness beyond a demo.
interrogation.askIntent: Force one concrete test or evaluation method.
questionExamples: What’s one automated test or evaluation you run to prove the system works end-to-end?
What’s the single metric you watch to catch regressions (latency, tool errors, retries, etc.)?

discovery.concern: I can’t yet tell what’s genuinely new versus a standard pattern.
discovery.askIntent: Make the novelty crisp and defensible.
questionExamples: What’s the one thing your approach does that most similar projects don’t?
If I saw five demos in a row, what detail would make yours stand out?

interrogation.concern: The ‘wow’ may be surface-level if it’s easy to copy.
interrogation.askIntent: Clarify why this isn’t trivial to replicate.
questionExamples: What part is hardest to copy: data, workflow, integration, or UX—and why?
If someone copied the UI in a weekend, what would they still be missing?

discovery.concern: I need a vivid picture of who benefits and what changes for them.
questionExamples: Who is the first user you’d put this in front of tomorrow, and what would they do differently after 10 minutes?
What’s the clearest ‘before vs after’ improvement your demo is aiming at?

interrogation.concern: The impact claim is plausible but not yet grounded.
interrogation.askIntent: Ask for one grounded estimate without sounding like an investor template.
questionExamples: If this works, what does it save or improve (time, cost, errors) in a typical week for that user?
What’s your best guess of the impact per user, even if it’s a rough estimate?

discovery.concern: The story might be unclear to someone seeing it for the first time.
questionExamples: If you had 20 seconds to set context before the demo, what would you say?
What’s the one screenshot or moment that best explains the value?

interrogation.concern: Judges need to see clearly how Gemini 3 was used, not just that it was used.
interrogation.askIntent: Force a crisp explanation of Gemini 3’s role + tooling.
questionExamples: Can you name the exact place Gemini 3 is used and what input/output it produces?
What would break if Gemini 3 was removed from the system?
